channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Southeast University on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Aligning Vision Models with Human Aesthetics in Retrieval: Benchmarks and Algorithms
item.description: This paper presents a novel method to align vision models with human aesthetics in image retrieval, using large language models (LLMs) for query rephrasing and preference-based reinforcement learning …

item.title: ControlSynth Neural ODEs: Modeling Dynamical Systems with Guaranteed Convergence
item.description: ControlSynth Neural ODEs (CSODEs) guarantee convergence in complex dynamical systems via tractable linear inequalities, improving neural ODE modeling.

item.title: Generalization Analysis for Label-Specific Representation Learning
item.description: Researchers derived tighter generalization bounds for label-specific representation learning (LSRL) methods, improving understanding of LSRL’s success and offering guidance for future algorithm develo…

item.title: Lever LM: Configuring In-Context Sequence to Lever Large Vision Language Models
item.description: Lever-LM configures effective in-context demonstrations for large vision-language models using a small language model, significantly improving their performance on visual question answering and image …

item.title: LIVE: Learnable In-Context Vector for Visual Question Answering
item.description: LIVE, a novel learnable in-context vector, significantly improves visual question answering by reducing computational costs and enhancing accuracy compared to traditional ICL methods.

item.title: Prune and Repaint: Content-Aware Image Retargeting for any Ratio
item.description: Prune and Repaint: A new content-aware method for superior image retargeting across any aspect ratio, preserving key features and avoiding artifacts.

item.title: SimVG: A Simple Framework for Visual Grounding with Decoupled Multi-modal Fusion
item.description: SimVG: A simpler, faster visual grounding framework with decoupled multi-modal fusion, achieving state-of-the-art performance.

item.title: Unveiling LoRA Intrinsic Ranks via Salience Analysis
item.description: SalientLoRA unveils optimal LoRA ranks by analyzing rank salience via time-series analysis, improving fine-tuning efficiency and performance significantly.

item.title: What Makes Partial-Label Learning Algorithms Effective?
item.description: Unlocking Partial-Label Learning: A new study reveals surprisingly simple design principles for highly accurate algorithms, dramatically simplifying future research and boosting performance.
